org.rakiura.cpn.gui
Class CPNPlaceFigure

java.lang.Object
  org.rakiura.draw.AbstractFigure
      org.rakiura.draw.figure.AttributeFigure
          org.rakiura.draw.figure.EllipseFigure
              org.rakiura.cpn.gui.CPNPlaceFigure
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, PlaceListener, CPNAbstractFigure, org.rakiura.draw.Figure, org.rakiura.draw.ParentFigure
public class CPNPlaceFigure
extends org.rakiura.draw.figure.EllipseFigure
implements CPNAbstractFigure, PlaceListener

Represents graphically a CPN place. Figure representing a place in a CPN.

Since:
3.0
Version:
4.1.0 $Revision: 1.62 $
Author:
Mariusz Nowostawski

Field Detail

DELAY

public static int DELAY

Constructor Detail

CPNPlaceFigure

public CPNPlaceFigure()
Creates new CPNPlaceFigure with a default size and colour.

CPNPlaceFigure

public CPNPlaceFigure(Place aPlace)
Creates a new PlaceFigure with the provided Place to listen to. Name and annotations of the place are displayed. The place is a yellow circle with the DEFAULT_SIZE equal to 30pt. Above the circle the name is displayed in bold. The number of tokens is displayed in the circle. The contents of tokens is displayed on the right side of the circle. The display of the name can be switched off.

Parameters:
aPlace - a Place that is to be displayed by this CPNPlaceFigure
See Also:
setNameVisible(boolean)

inspect

public boolean inspect(org.rakiura.draw.DrawingView aView,
                       boolean alternate)
Inspects the figure. If alternate is false, it will show/hide the tokenscount and name respectively. If alternate is true, it will reset its display.

Specified by:
inspect in interface org.rakiura.draw.Figure
Overrides:
inspect in class org.rakiura.draw.AbstractFigure
Parameters:
aView - the DrawingView of this figure
alternate - alternate inspection or not?
Returns:
true if inspection is done, false if no figure could be inspected.

updateTokensText

protected void updateTokensText()
Updates the text that shows the contents of the tokens. Should only be called if place != null, otherwise null pointer exception will be thrown.

release

public void release()
Releases the figures resources. This method is usually called after it has permanently been removed from a drawing. It stops listening to its place.

Specified by:
release in interface org.rakiura.draw.Figure
Overrides:
release in class org.rakiura.draw.AbstractFigure

deReference

public void deReference()
Makes sure that the figure does not listen to a netElement anymore. Use it if a figure is not displayed anymore. e.g. when the drawing is closed.

Specified by:
deReference in interface CPNAbstractFigure
See Also:
CPNAbstractFigure.reReference()

reReference

public void reReference()
Makes sure that the figure does listen to its netElement again. Use it if a figure is displayed again. e.g. when a drawing is redisplayed.

Specified by:
reReference in interface CPNAbstractFigure
See Also:
CPNAbstractFigure.deReference()
